Posts.Title: AIs and acupuncture

Posts.Content: Hi HappyFeet1 I too had lumpectomy, SNB & 3 weeks radiotherapy this year over the summer.  Now 5 months into a 10 year tamoxifen journey. I took around 3 weeks off work after the op  but I am incredibly lucky to have an amazing, flexible employer / job (part time and can work from home sometimes).   During RT I predominantly worked from home.  However. If I hadn’t been able to do so I would very definitely have struggled to maintain working throughout the whole thing, I found it exhausting - although I didn’t realise how much it took it out of me until a while later.  In fact, this week will be the first week that I will work my usual 5 (short) days in the office (and I don’t have a manual job lol!!) since my op in mid-May. So, please don’t underestimate the time needed for your  recovery, listen to your body and take whatever time you need fully recuperate.  The very best of luck to you.   Clare

Posts.Content: Hi XjulieX I know we have had a very similar journey and I just wanted to add my support, sympathy and empathy. With my HR hat on, I’m so maddened to hear that you weren’t looked after better by your employer.  It doesn’t take much for your line manager/HR manager to just even drop you a note every couple of weeks to check in on you.  You should most definitely not be pressurised by them to return!  Do you have any annual leave left you could possibly use? You mentioned you will ask for reduced hours as in a phased return which is an excellent idea especially as I expect  you’ll be paid more than SSP by doing so (how the gov think anyone can survive on SSP is a mystery).  In any case an employer has to consider any request for flexible working ie reduced hours/condensed hours/home working etc temporarily or permanently. For me, 4 weeks post RT, I was very lucky to have just gone back to work after a 2 week holiday yesterday feeling fighting fit - today however i’m truly shattered and I’m fully expecting this to continue for some time, up and down!  Its so hard isn’t it? But hang in in there - this period will pass - it won’t last forever.  Clare x
Posts.Title: Need a rant and a kick up the a$$!!

Posts.Content: Morning XjulieX I too struggle with those who have ignored what I went through - not so much work but one or 2 friends who I feel quite hurt about tbh!  (One of whom I’m seeing on Saturday for the first time since diagnosed, so deep breath and shoulders back for me!!!!) Yes whatever your doctor puts on your ‘Fit Note’, your employer has to follow.  It might be that Dr ticks the box that says ‘phased return advised’ or something similar but you could ask your Dr to write ‘reduced hours recommended’ or whatever you think might work for you.  I hope you have a better day today and feel free to share rants any time at all! clare
